Therefore the inductive case holds. Q.E.D.

We prove by induction on n. The base case is trivial. Inductive case: when n is 0 it is also trivial. When $n>0$, let $m=2^n$, and we have $3^m - 1 \equiv 4*m \pmod{8*m}$.
